newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA - PM SEES Q2 INFLATION AT 2.4 PERCENT.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA - PM SEES Q2 INFLATION AT 2.4 PERCENT.

text.p: Lithuanian Prime Minister Gediminas Vagnorius said on Thursday that inflation in the Baltic state was expected to fall to 2.4 percent in the second quarter of the year from 3.5 percent in the first quarter.
Lithuania's annual inflation rate in 1996 was 13.1 percent, well down from 35.7 percent in 1995, and the government's forecast for 1997 is 10 to 12 percent.

The prime minister also told a news conference that his government was committed to gradually increasing the real income of the country's population but warned that it could not promise rapid and radical improvements.
